rComments: In lecture, he is an AWFUL professor. The TAs are the saving grace, but even they can only do so much working with him. His assignments range from really easy, to ridiculously hard, so always get a head start. Read the book, learn to use google, and make damn sure you understand all the assignments given. This class tests your ability to self-teach

I really don't understand where all the hate comes in, he may not be the best teacher, but at least it's an easy class (if you're mildly experienced in any programming language) and the assignments are pretty cool too. I mean the class is ACCELERATED intro to programming, of course it's going to be hard. That being said he was pretty unprepared.

If I hadn't already had programming experience, I would be totally lost, he's very unprepared in lecture and his way of explaining the concepts is confusing and useless. Assignments are inconsistent in their difficulty, and often don't have you practice the intended concept. Tests aren't too hard, but you want to know some Java before taking this.

Do not get him for this class. He makes it a lot more difficult than it needs to be. I passed because of the TA. Partial credit is your best friend on exams. He was at least 2 weeks behind in teaching concepts we had to write programs for.

Not a lot of good to be said about this guy. Openly rude to students, usually unprepared for class, did a poor job of explaining even basic concepts. I hear he was better in office hours, but the TAs were the saving grace of this class. Be ready to teach yourself the material.
He was never available to answer questions and never replies to e-mails. The textbook will be your friend. He basically recites the book, lectures are boring and pointless.

i had no interest in the class beforehand, but the teacher is really clear on complex concepts and helps students out very well. I had no prior knowledge of Java (though i had some knowledge with Gamemaker) and it was really easy. i can ace java now. do NOT take 5J+11, take this instead. the lab is really easy, hw and exams are REALLY easy. a++++

Probably one of the worst teachers I've ever had. Made me jump through a bunch of hoops to test into the next class only (after completing them) to tell me he'd changed his mind, and then ignore my emails and refuse to explain why. Huge waste of time, very rude and dismissive. Definitely not interested in his students' learning/welfare. Avoid him!

I didn't like this class. If u take it here are some pointers: it goes VERY quickly, do NOT take it if you haven't programmed b4 or don't like it. Prof. teaches necessary skills AFTER each assign. is due, and the grading criteria is often mis-focused (you will lose as many pts for unrelated mistakes like math eq's as you will for programmingerrors)
He is extremely nice and helpful. lecture is very clear, labs are easy, only 2 programming assignments are somewhat tough. I liked his class!
Alex is easily one of the best teachers on campus. He really loves sci. vis. and usually seems more than willing to help. He is very presentable and sets a good atmosphere for his class.
Interesting class. He LOVES computer visualization, and not much else having to do with graphics. Programs were pretty cool. I'd say I enjoyed it overall.

I did my undergrad at an extremely highly rated computer science school. I will say that Alex's class was flat out better then either of the undergraduate computer graphics classes I took there, and arguably better then the grad special topics in graphics class I took at my undergraduate institution.  I would say more good things were there space.
This professor sucks, likes to through curve balls on exams and the programs are hard if your working alone, doesnt like to help students at all, this is probably why he had a black eye.

READ THE BOOK!!! When he assigns Programs, the student(go out and look for the answerâ€¦he will go over the concept after the program is due. Programs 1 and 2 easy, the rest of the programs, DO NOT PROCRASTINATE!!! Do the examples given on the JAVA book. Read and you'll be fine.

I don't know what these good reviews are about. Doesn't explain anything, introduces very few concepts, and gives no information about programs that are due. In other words, he doesn't really teach at all. You will have to read the entire book to get anything out of his class at all. Useless.

Difficult class for 12A in comparison with some other profs, but he prepares you well for Mackey in 12B.  Very clear in class -- make sure you pay attention because he spells things out you will need in your programming projects.  Would definitely take a class from again.
Professor Pang taught a great intro to programming class. Very easy to talk to, not intimidating and very knowledgeable. One of my favorite professors to date.
